message_1: In a group of 5 friends, they each have a shirt of one of three primary colors: red, blue, or yellow. How many different color assignments are possible if no two friends can have the same color shirt?
message_2: If no two friends can have the same color shirt, then it is not possible to assign shirts to a group of 5 friends using only 3 colors. There will always be at least two friends with the same color shirt.
